data.title: Super Marcato Bros. VGM Podcast MEGATHREAD
data.meta_description:
Season finale

Episode 475: Kicking Back

I have not listened to the episode yet so I'm not sure why the tracklist is rather short this week. Perhaps it's...
data.text:
As Ricky Bobby once said, "you're either first or last."

Episode 476: First & Last

This is a neat little idea. Playing a track from a series first game and then from their latest. All the games here go way back. I think Kirby being the newest as the first game was from 1992 if memory serves me correctly. Well, actually I see the Bros. did not go with Street Fighter 1, but 2 instead, but a quick Wikipedia check tells me that was released in 1991. So Kirby is the babby of the group here.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/7/11/episode-476-first-amp-last

Apple Podcasts - https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/super-marcato-bros-video-game-music-podcast/id507835405

Tracklist:

Super Mario Bros. - Koji Kondo - Overworld

Super Mario Odyssey - Naoto Kubo - New Donk City

Mega Man - Manami Matsumae - Cut Man

Mega Man 11 - Marika Suzuki - Dr. Wily Stage

Castlevania - Kinuyo Yamashita, Satoe Terashima - Wicked Child

Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 - Oscar Araujo - Satan

Kirby's Dream Land - Jun Ishikawa - Ending

Kirby Star Allies - Hirokazu Ando - Sudden Happy Ending

Sonic the Hedgehog - Masato Nakamura - Spring Yard Zone

Sonic Forces - Tomoya Ohtani - Network Terminal

Ys I: Ancient Ys Vanished - Yuzo Koshiro - Palace

Ys IX: Monstrum Nox - Hayato Sonoda, Takahiro Unisuga - New Life

The Legend of Zelda - Koji Kondo - Overworld

The Legend Of Zelda: Breath of The Wild - Yasuaki Iwata - Hateno Village

Final Fantasy - Nobuo Uematsu - Temple of Chaos

Final Fantasy XV - Yoko Shimomura - Valse Di Fantastica

Street Fighter II - Yoko Shimomura - Vega's Theme

Street Fighter V - Kanzuki Beach - Keiki Kobayashi - Malaysia Stage

Metal Gear - Kazuki Muraoka - Jungle Infiltration

Metal Gear Survive - Haruna Kubo - Do-Or-Die

F@#k it! We'll do it live. WE'LL DO IT LIVE!!!!

Episode 477: Reeeemix 8: Covers

The Bros. have spoken. Live performances. Real instruments. Whatever you wanna call it. No Zircon-esque electro happening in this episode. I'm down with the constraint. The boom of live musicians covering vidya tunes has seemingly grown a lot. I know they aren't new to the game, but I've seen Bit Brigade live before (they aren't on this episode). That was 3 years or 2. Enough people came out to a small venue to watch them shred through Mega Man 3 music while a speedrunner did his thing. This episode has the right idea.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/7/18/episode-477-reeeemix-8-covers

Apple Podcasts - https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/super-marcato-bros-video-game-music-podcast/id507835405

Tracklist:

Dr. Pez - Pokemon Trading Card Game - Normal Battle (Band Cover)

insaneintherain - Gangplank Galleon (Donkey Kong Country) Jazz Arrangement

Tim de Man - Zelda: Ocarina of Time - Hyrule Field Celtic Cover

Ru's Piano - Dragon Quest - Overture March

Tyler Mire - Hydrocity Zone Act II - High Octane Funk Big Band!

Kirby's Dream Band - Bat Out of HAL - Undertale

RichaadEB & Ryan Lafford - Autumn Mountain Battle (Paper Mario: The Origami King) Cover

The Consouls - A Silly Talking Fish (Shovel Knight King of Cards) Jazz Cover

Super Guitar Bros. - Super Mario 64 - Bowser's Road - Acoustic Guitar Cover

Dwelling of Duels Various Artists - The Devil's Spear

The 8-Bit Big Band feat. Adam Neely - Saria's Song (Contemporary Jazz Orchestra Cover)

DiscoCactus - The Legend of Zelda - The Forces Of Evil Have Taken Over (The Dance Floor)

Super Soul Bros. - Mother - Pollyanna

Patti Rudisill - Tifa's Theme (Final Fantasy VII)

YamaYama - Vampire Killer (Castlevania)

The Hit Points - Castlevania: Symphony Of The Night - Dance of Pales Bluegrass Arrangement

OstilMusic - Chrono Cross - Radical Dreamers (Piano Cover)

Steven Morris - To Sunshine Forest - Mother 3 Cover

Super Marcato Bros. - Shin Onigashima - Staff Roll

Nice bit of bonus info. Points out that something got screwed up by the team implementing the track into the game:

It's interesting you mention that. I only used a DX-7 and a Roland 505 drum machine and I had everything the way I wanted it. When the game came out, somehow they managed to change some of the sounds that I had laid down. Also, the phrasing. They quantized it a bit and screwed up my original performance.

But I still have to admit it ain't exactly making my ears smile haha. Rough listen and not a track I'd show someone to convince them that even games in the olden days had worthwhile tunes based on songwriting alone.

edit: By the way. I haven't added any posts from the bonus episodes the Bros. have put out the past 2 weeks. I'll just let those pass by. I'll update this thread when a regular numbered episode comes out. One of the hosts is getting married (or maybe already got married in that time) in case someone hasn't been listening to recent episodes.

A beautiful chip shot from the bunker and a chance for a birdie. A marvelous shot really. We've seen others struggle with the same area on this hole.

Episode 478: Golf Games

Yeah plenty of games to choose from for this episode. It is pretty amusing how a sport that seems like it would be the most boring as a videogame actually is pretty fun. Heck even the Golden Tee games with the roller trackball controllers in the arcade. But usually it's more interesting when golf games put some goofy spin on the game.

And for you, Ori, I give you the light of Earendil. May it be a light to you in dark places when all other lights go out.

Got little to add as I never played the game and only heard maybe a track or two from it before listening to this episode. That's ok though. The Bros. basically didn't play it either (one of them played some of it.), but decided the OST was worth spotlighting.

Episode 481: Gran Turismo Grooves

This is about the chill tracks from the GT series. I myself not being a sim car fan couldn't tell you much about where the tracks are featured. The Bros. assume that a lot of might be menu music or stuff not while the race is going on. I can see why that would make sense.

Episode Page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/8/29/episode-481-gran-turismo-grooves

Episode 484: Team Ico Trilogy

Very nice spotlight. They kinda zip right past Ico which kinda surprised me. In a way you probably could takckle these games in a "less tracks, but more describing" kind of format in an individual episode. That would have been cool too. But yeah, not much Ico here. Since the Bros. haven't played any of these games, they also get some help from a few friends. I find that a welcome addition. Not only for the sake of giving some context (even if that doesn't really bother me in other episodes where they do spotlights on games they haven't played), but also just different enthusiastic voices and takes to add some more flavor to our usual 2 piece palette.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/9/19/episode-484-team-ico-trilogy

Episode 485: Deltarune

The second chapter of this game came out recently. I don't actually know anything about the game itself. Mainly cause I'm one of those "cool, let me know when all the chapters are out so I can play it all at once" people. Though I don't even know how long these chapters last. What I do know is that I enjoy Toby's music. So I'm looking forward to hearing these tracks, as I've only heard some in the past and no longer recall what they sound like.

Episode 487: Listener Show & Tell 11

As usual I miss the memo on any upcoming show and tell episode. Maybe it's announced on Twitter or in the Discord, but I don't ever venture to see so, I guess that's on me haha. But I'm always down for these episodes. I look at the tracklist and it's all over the place which is awesome. At least half looks like stuff I haven't listened to and a few I wasn't even aware of existing. So cool cool.

Episode 490: Animal Crossing: New Horizons

November brings in episodes related to Nintendo games. Why not kick it of with a big hitter from last year? A nice easy going ost that some of us may have heard too much of haha. Actually, not me personally. My copy of the game is still sealed so uh... I guess I'll be hearing most o these tunes for the first time.

Episode 492: Golden Sun

Yeah this series hasn't quite gotten too much love over the years has it? No Super Smash Bros. character or something more significant. I know the last game on the DS (or was it 3DS) wasn't a defining RPG for its respective system. That's the way it goes sometimes. I have fond memories of the first entry though and the music played a big part in that. Even at the time when I didn't know about the limits of the GBA sound chip compared to say the SNES sound chip. It simply sounded good to me from a 16-bit sound standpoint (It's a bit confusing to me. The GBA could output 16-bit but all the samples were 8-bit? Anyways, you know what I mean. Could do more than the regular Game Boy).

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/11/14/episode-492-golden-sun

Episode 493: Super Mario Forgotten Mushrooms

Over so many episodes and years of Nintendo months, you'd think most Mario platformer games have had their tunes featured. Well of course there were bound to be some stragglers. This episode tries to remedy that by playing tracks that never made it it to any show. I can see why too. Some pieces were just too brief and others, perhaps weren't quite as memorable or key as other tracks from their respective games. The one that stuck out to me here was Super Mario Sunshine's Bianco Hills.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/11/21/episode-493-super-mario-forgotten-mushrooms

Episode 495: Marcato Radio 28

Everybody busy. No talk, just music. Notice that there is a DQ10 track here. Sugiyama passed away not too long ago. Think maybe back in September. A fairly infuriating person who did have a musical gift. Some of the stuff he did for the Dragon Quest games was all world. Nice to see some Gravity Rush 2 making this week's tracklist. Heck it was even chosen as the track of the week. 5 episodes away from 500. Dang fellas. I know the Bros. have stated that they got something special planned for it. Maybe even a big change to the podcast itself? Well, we got some regular style episodes coming out still till then.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/12/5/episode-495-marcato-radio-28

Episode 498: I Can't Believe It's Not VGM

Last episode of the year. The tracks that are from the late 70s to the mid 80s are ones that seem more obvious. You can see how a lot of this type of stuff would be influential to VGM composers in the 80s and 90s. It's the stuff that is earlier or later that sort of caught my eye. Mainly because, yeah VGM music is so normal now that it's kinda weird to hear something not meant to be VGM in the last 10 years, but it sounds like it could be VGM. And that track from the 60s is also one of those cool outliers.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2021/12/26/episode-498-i-cant-believe-its-not-vgm

EDIT - Oops. Something went wrong with the post. Was missing the episode details. Now updated.

Five Oh Oh

Episode 500: A Super Marcato Bros. Celebration

Hah. Look at that picture. It's like seeing an athlete in their rookie year and then you got where they are now in their prime. Congrats to the Bros. for getting to episode 500. 500 hundred episodes without missing a week. That's pretty wild for just two people doing this on their own. Plenty of people chime in to give their thanks and even some questions. From longtime listeners who have even been on the show to some we haven't heard from in person before (like say a few Discord people). Just good vibes all around. But there is some music too. The Bros. mention that they will be changing the style of episodes going forward. They won't even be numbering them. I maybe missed it if they mentioned it, but I don't think there was any specific kind of format that they are planning to switch to. Merely that it won't be the classic format we have been accustomed to for, well forever haha.

Once again, big props to reaching 500 episodes. And I know the 10 year anniversary is also coming up very soon. It's been impressive how the show has stayed alive, informative, enthusiastic, and fun. I can't say how many podcasts that start out with the hosts being really into the podcast and then as time goes by they either aren't as into it anymore (understandable) or even sometimes seemingly resentful lol. The Bros. keep the good vibes (even if sometimes critical, though I'd say that's pretty rare) regardless of what they cover. Thanks fellas. Looking forward to what you have in store for us.

Series Spotlight: Sonic the Hedgehog

The new style of the podcast is a go. There are some guests on the episodes. The discussions are different than the typical "listen to part of track and talk about it" style that was tradition for most of the old episodes. You still get that too, but then other parts are for example discussing a certain phase of Sonic music during a period of time and how it fit in during that time period with contemporary music. Give it a shot. I think the change up is fine and it's neat to hear from other people too. That happened in the past on the odd episode and I liked having some other voice even if the two main Bros. are great at hosting the podcast.

Episode page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2022/2/27/series-spotlight-sonic-the-hedgehog

Apple Podcasts - https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/super-marcato-bros-video-game-music-podcast/id507835405

Sonic Generations - Masato Nakamura - Green Hill Zone Act 1

Sonic 3 - Tomonori Sawada & Yoshiaki Kashima - Angel Island Zone Act 1

Sonic Mania - Tee Lopes - Lights, Camera, Action! (Studiopolis Zone Act 1)

Sonic Mania - SEGA Sound Team arr. Tee Lopes - Flying Battery Zone Act 1

I haven't quite acclimated to the podcast diverting from the old format. These last two episodes I feel like I have to listen more intently. I usually play this podcast while falling asleep which the old format seemed to work well with haha. It was just, "here's a nice tune and now we add our two cents on it." Now the discussion part and breakdowns and other such things demand a bit more attention. So yeah I'll have to give these two episodes a relisten.

Marcato Classic: Bad Music 7

Crappy tunes whether on purpose or not, find your way here. Just wait until they get to the guy who was the composer for Sonic Chronicles. Oddly enough another game with "Chronicles" in it lol.

Wasn't expecting to see Theo Fleury as an artist popping up here. Not because the song is good. It's just standard generic country pop. It's just that, hey I didn't realize he was making music. Theo was mostly known as a great hockey player who played in the NHL for many years and even represented Canada in the Olympics. His life story is really interesting. Severely dark at times. The man has gone through some ugliness in his life. Wikipedia him to get a general understanding. On one hand I'm always rooting for him in that sense, but there's been moments where I'm like "eh I don't really agree much with this guy on some other matters." But yeah, heck of a lot better as a hockey player back in the day than as a musician.

Marcato Classic: Shovel Knight Dig

Always excited to see new music from Jake Kaufman. Shovel Knight is sort of the soundtrack that brought attention to Jake Kaufman on a larger scale. Though some may have already picked up on him from the Mighty Switch Force games or Double Dragon Neon, or perhaps his work on the Shantae series which goes back to the early 00s. But yeah seeing a new Shovel Knight game with a Kaufman score is like peanut butter and jelly on a sandwich. A tried and true combo.

Those Rabbids remind me of Minions :/

Nintendo Month '22: Mario + Rabbids Sparks of Hope

I glossed over this episode to be honest. The main thing that surprised me was that Yoko Shimomura worked on the sequel. Maybe I'll check out the music on Spotify. Shockingly it's there. Shocking because Nintendo usually doesn't understand what it means to be in the 21st century company when comes to modern conveniences. But I do see at the bottom of the Spotify page it's a copyright by Ubisoft Music, so I guess that sort of makes more sense.

Don't wake up da babby

Discord Discotheque: Kid Friendly

Ok this episode is pretty awesome. Props to the podcast's discord. Very good selection of tracks that vaguely are supposed to be kid friendly in some respect. Great to see Napple Tale show up. Yoshi's Wolly World? Yes please (as opposed to Crafty World :/ ). Piranha Plant Lullaby? Yep. The discord made great pics. And Heal from Ico is... I mean as far as save point tracks go, gotta be top 5. I just get cozy thinking about it. Man, get that game on Steam and PS5. Don't even remake it. Just port that PS3 version.

Episode Page - http://www.supermarcatobros.com/podcast/2023/1/22/discord-discotheque-kid-friendly

And the award goes to...

Current Events: Game Music GRAMMYs

Really nice discussion here. I'm usually less hyped about episodes that are low on the quantity of music, but the talk between the Bros. was great all around. The middle segment by Arthur (someone from the Discord I guess?) is an appropriate companion piece for this episode. I'm sort of halfway there with Arthur.
